title: Limited quality, limited extension support, no Ubuntu One support
comment: Not bad, but not great: 1) Opens ODT on a touch, but not ODP (no activity registered) - to open an ODP, you have to walk the file system - but I use Ubuntu One, so that's not a terribly obvious or intuitive exercise. 2) Very simple ODPs (simple bordering on simplistic) open fine, but anything remotely complex looks, well, awful - formatting is lost, images are lost, etc. 3) Performance is OK, not better, not worse. 4) Tablet support is not at all thought out: With tablet in portrait mode, cannot zoom out enough to make slide fit window width-wise - if I'm OK with, software should support it, don't force me to work your way.
A 1-star rating is a bit harsh if you ask me. Anyway, feel free to contact me at tomtasche@gmail.com if you want to talk about your suggestions.

title: Does what I need
comment: I downloaded the app based on the great number of positive reviews and thus was surprised that my own initial experience was so disappointing However after posting an initial review entitled 'disappointing' I received a fairly prompt response from Tom who explained that the size of my document required the 'reload without limit' feature to be activated in order for me to be able to view it properly and thus use the search function effectively. Given that my phone is no longer state of the Arc (Sony Ericsson 2011 model) with Android 2.3 and limited RAM the document is slow to load but that has nothing to do with the app and is why the 'reload without limit' feature exists in the first place.  Now that my contract is up and I'm not upgrading my phone I shall probably root my phone to upgrade the OS and hopefully improve the performance by transferring apps to the SD card. Until then I shall stick with the free version as it 'does what I need' and I can live with the ads.
We'd love to see the document you're referring to! Maybe we can fix it. Please contact us at tomtasche@gmail.com
